title: Flight Test Director - Mission Systems
description: Direct the planning, coordination, execution and reporting of pre-flight, flight and post-flight activities of a specialized airborne mission system to ensure system readiness and to validate and sell off program requirements to an international Customer. Lead a team of test engineers during, and in support of, flight operations, coordinating and staging of support equipment, developing and maintaining aircraft test schedules, and coordinating with other organizations associated with test readiness. Direct execution of ground and flight tests. Serve as liaison between the engineering team and Customer (both US and international).

title: Systems Engineering Manager & Project Engineering Lead
description: Managed a functional engineering organization of 21 systems engineers, responsible for coordinating subordinate employee recruitment, selection and training, performance assessment, work assignments, salary, and recognition/disciplinary actions. Drove day to day tasking and technical direction, monitored and tracked cost and schedule activities, ensured execution and delivery of program requirements and artifacts, and represented the organization at various program boards and reviews, to include weekly program status and ERBs. Provided direct budget and schedule input to planning, ROM, and ECP activities. Perform CAM responsibilities.

title: Chief Engineer, Senior Scout Program
description: Directed the technical efforts of a multi-disciplined team of 100+ engineers in support of a major USAF manned airborne Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) program, executing an average of 20 contracts valued at approximately $80 million annually. Maintained oversight of all technical tasks, and personally responsible for engineering decisions, recommendations and technical management functions necessary to ensure successful program results. Provide necessary engineering guidance to project team members, ensuring satisfactory attainment of program milestones and schedule commitments. Managed the development of engineering inputs to $30-$50 million of new proposals annually, to include estimates of engineering labor, travel, subcontractor work content, and authoring of the management and technical volume of each proposal. Personally developed the contract performance schedules and input basis of estimate using the WBOE tool. Managed the program integrated master schedule. Participate in the collection and analysis of EVM data.

title: Technical Lead a& Systems Engineering Manager
description: As Technical Lead, performed combined engineering program management (EPM) and chief engineer (CE) responsibilities, directing the technical efforts of a multi-disciplined team of engineers in support of a major USAF manned airborne Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) program. Personally led program growth from a staff of four engineers (two systems, one software, and a sys admin) to a staff of over 50 engineers (encompassing SEIT, software, mechanical, electrical and sys admin), with contracts growing from $400K to approximately $50 million annually. Maintained oversight of all technical tasks, and personally responsible for engineering decisions, recommendations and technical management functions necessary to ensure successful program results. As Functional Manager for an engineering organization of 20 systems and information assurance engineers, responsible for coordinating subordinate employee recruitment, selection and training, performance assessment, work assignments, salary, and recognition/disciplinary actions. Mentor systems and integration and test engineers.
